Add file button has no feedback at all. When I try to load an image in my sketch it generates the file not found exception. Also, it should automatically add every single file in the project folder to the compiled version, this would avoid so many errors... Ps: still unable to use loadImage() function from processing...
google_play_reviews.replyContent: The "add file" button doesn't always work, but you should be able to manually add files to the sketch folder in the "Sketchbook" folder on the external storage. Files should go into a folder called "data" in the sketch folder - all files in the data folder get embedded in the built application as assets.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: You should be able to open a .pde file by selecting it in a file manager and then choosing APDE to open it. Alternatively, you can copy the sketch folder into the sketchbook, which is a folder named "Sketchbook" on the external storage (configurable in settings).

google_play_reviews.content: Good

It's a totally awesome app. I think I'm addicted to it. Has several deployment modes, the special characters it adds to the top of your keyboard is a very lovely feature, & the best thing of all, the one real shocker, is that it has no ads. Also, on the camera libraries I complained about earlier, I have come to understand that that is a core Processing issue; & that is why I had to come here and upgrade the rating to 5 stars, which is what I honestly feel the app deserves.
Great IDE. Not very easy to use. But it's worth for the learning curve. Even a APK converter is embedded.

Processing on a phone. What could be more perfect? You have that cool idea on a train communte? You can have it sketched out in APDE by the time you arrive. Mobile is the ideal platform, truest to the spirit of the Processing project.

You should be able to share sketches through Git, is there a different sharing method that you had in mind?

Did you install the libraries with the installer or manually? If you installed them manually, then you need to run the DX Dexer. See the wiki: https://goo.gl/YAXHxE

You should be able to move files to your computer over a USB. Alternatively, you can sink your sketches to a remote Git repo. We are planning to add Drive/Dropbox support eventually.

I've programmed many apps with APDE, and I love everything about it, but 
there's one thing that I HATE about APDE, sometimes it just deletes the 
entire code of one of your sketches, out of nowhere, and you have no way to 
restore it. I was working on a super cool game and it just deleted 
everything, and today it happened again with another app. I really love 
APDE and the possibilities you have with it, but this bug is just 
unforgivable. The latest update said that that this bug was fixed, but it 
wasn't. I really hope that the APDE team reads this and try again to fix 
that problem, it's just heartbreaking when one of your loved programs just 
go to the void and eternal darkness.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: This bug was thought to be resolved because we have not received any reports of code deletion with the latest version, including users that had previously experienced the bug. Clearly the bug still exists. Please post in this issue on GitHub with any information that you have about reproducing the bug: https://github.com/Calsign/APDE/issues/24

google_play_reviews.content:
You cannot edit example sketches unless it is saved to sketchbook. Examples 
will appear small so you need to figure out the correct size base on device 
resolution.All in all this app is great for practicing processing or people 
who want to start programming as the codes are similar to an arduino
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
The intention is for examples to serve as a base that you can return to. "Copy to Sketchbook" from the menu gives you a copy that you can edit.

The text size should scale to the screen automatically, but if it is too small you can change it in settings.

If you have further concerns or or comments then please feel free to send us an email.

google_play_reviews.content:
It is absolutely brilliant. Perfect dev environment on your phone. I use 
processing on my PC as well. Tried using it to build apps but the exported 
apk files wouldn't run on my phone. Tjis app allows me to run my sketches 
on my phone. I wonder tho, is it possible to export to apk on this app so i 
can run it on other phones or upload to play store?
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Yes, you can export sketches: from the menu, go to Tools and select "Export Signed Package". There is more information available on the wiki: https://goo.gl/aEpJsX

If you have further questions or comments, please feel free to send us an email.

google_play_reviews.content: sooo bad wow please get the ui to at least work
google_play_reviews.replyContent: What issue are you experiencing? Most users do not have UI issues. We are perfectly willing to answer questions or fix bugs if you reach out to us and provide specific examples of what is going wrong.

google_play_reviews.content:
After installing sketch, tried to run the file but it keeps on asking to 
install the sketch again but the sketch is already installed. Especially 
running with P3D transformations and PImage.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
APDE builds and installs the sketch every time that you press "run" to reflect any changes that you made to the sketch. If you want to run the sketch again without reinstalling it, you can find it in the Android app drawer like any other app.

Please send us an email if you have further questions or concerns.

google_play_reviews.content: awesome

Hey, great app, just wondering if there's a way of not having to manually delete apps since there's no preview yet and I regularly have to check my sketches (coz I regularly fk up my code :) ). Other than that great. Thanks Thank you for creating the preview mode. Solves that issue! Cheers!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: There is not currently a way to delete all sketches. You can uninstall the current sketch from APDE's tools menu. The problem with uninstalling automatically or all at once is that it requires you to click through the system uninstall dialog for each app. We will look into a more streamlined process for managing installed sketches, however.

google_play_reviews.content: Awesome 😍

How do I change the default folder? How do I get the location of the 
default folder? How do I add a project (pde files from other device) ?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: By default the sketchbook is stored in "Sketchbook" on the external storage. You can add a sketch by putting it in the sketchbook folder. To change this location, go to Settings/General.

google_play_reviews.content:
A really well built environment for writing processing code on android. It 
has everything you need to build a complete app and upload it directly to 
play store.

It's truly awesome what you've, but I find it kind of useless since there's 
no way to import sketches into the app. I often work on projects on my 
computer and would be nice to work on them on the go with my phone.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: All you have to do to import a sketch is stick it in the "Sketchbook" folder on the external storage. You can configure this location from Settings/General. You can even use the Git manager to synchronize sketches through an online repository. Please send us an email if you have further questions.

google_play_reviews.content: Great app! To save, you can click move to sketchbook
Awesome app to program in processing on the go....loved it..
google_play_reviews.replyContent: These functions worked in our testing. Please send us an email with the code you are trying so that we can sort out the problem.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can add an image to the sketch's data folder from Sketch Properties / Add File. Then you can load that image in your sketch with loadImage(). Please send us an email if you have further questions.

Great stuff! Cool to have PDE on my phone. Waiting for some code completion ;)
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Code completion is a planned feature.

APDE provides a special character tray for typing braces, semicolons, and other characters that are difficult to access on a soft keyboard. You can open the tray by pressing the arrow at the right of the message area when the keyboard is visible.

Please send us an email if you have further questions.

google_play_reviews.content: Great app. But on my (Oreo) phone installing any compressed library leads to a crash. Did not do this on my previous phone. Is this a Oreo problem?

This is f***ing awesome! Simple, usable. The whole Processing setup so you can write code and compile right on the phone into an app that the phone can run. iOS would never be able to do this. Beautiful thing, thank you.
Wow! Just wow! Awesome job, keep up the good work.
great app only trouble is it keeps erasing my sketches :( a lot of work keeps dissapearing when p running in background
Great app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: This is a known bug. Please try force-stopping APDE from Android settings. If that doesn't work, then try restarting your phone. If that still doesn't work then you should be able to uninstall and reinstall APDE. If you have any more information about the bug or the above solutions don't work then please send us an email.

google_play_reviews.content: I use this app everyday. Has development stopped? Thanks
It compiles great, and actually has the necessary funcionality. The interface is a bit confusing, but nothing you can't do by reading the "getting started" page on GitHub lol

What do you mean by "editing style"?

You can create separate files - please see the the "Getting Started" wiki page: https://goo.gl/S58NGX

Please send us an email if you have additional questions or concerns.

google_play_reviews.content: finally, a weapon to surpass my computer science class and Metal Gear. thanks, Android.

This app is amazing for coding on the go. I just have two little quips, under the processing foundation there is no github repo to submit issues, so i have to resort to begging in the review section for you to see my bug report. When im using the app, the auto save will actually delete my code so that its a blank tab, then autosaves, so quite literally I watch the app delete all the code I just wrote, I'm unable to replicate this every single time, it happens about 1 in 5 times. Should happen 0 times. Why have a coding editor if it just deletes your code... EDIT: My past self was a bit more curt than necessary. I was not aware that this app was not under the development of the processing foundation, and I apologize.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Please note that APDE is not under the Processing Foundation. The GitHub is linked in the Google Play description.

The issue that you describe is a known critical bug. There is an issue for it already but we are still looking for a solution. Your input would be appreciated: https://goo.gl/9RCK8q

google_play_reviews.content: Library imports break the apking.  I can't make a new installed app after importing ketai zipped library.  AAPT exited code 1.  :/
Awesome app. I can comfortably create processing sketches straight on my phone

Exporting a signed apk and importing libraries both either do not work or are hard to use. There is a chance of losing your work since saving is automatic and sometimes it doesn't work. There are also some polish issues such as text formating glitches, some incorrect/missing highlighting, and other minor issues. There is no other app that competes with APDE and there is a lot of potiental here.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Autosaving should be fixed for the next release.

For exporting signed APKs and importing libraries please see our FAQ on the wiki: https://goo.gl/bggxyn

We are aware of the other issues that you describe. An improved syntax highlighter is on the to-do list.

If you see further problems or have any suggestions, please let us know!

google_play_reviews.replyContent: JavaScript mode (via Processing.js) is a planned feature. This would allow you to preview sketches as you describe.

google_play_reviews.content: I STARTED WITH APDE IN 2015 OR SO AND BOUGHT  A WINDOWS INSIGNIA TABLET TO USE IT AND IT WOULDNT INSTALL AFTER 9 DAYS SO  I FOUND I WASTED 135 DOLLARS AND GAVE THE TABLET TO MY FISH IN THE FISH TANK.  RCA TABLET IN 2016 LOLLIE POP ANDROID ATTEMPED APDE WITH LUCK BUT NO KETAI INSTALL SO IN 2017 I RELOADED APDE AND KETAI LIBRARY AND IT WORKS .  SO NOW I JUST BOUGHT A RCA 7 INCH WITH INTELL ATOM ANDROID MARSHMELLO AND APDE AND KETAI BOTH RUN WELL !  ONLY PROBLEM IS AFTER ALL THIS WAITING I FOUND THAT APDE IS NOT PROCESSING ITS A RESEMBELANCE OF PROCESSING AND IT WILL NOT USE THE SAME SERIAL COMMUNICATION.  I FOUND NO SERIAL COMMUNICATION LIBRARY LIKE PROCESSING.SERIAL.  SO THATS IT ILL HAVE TO BY ANOTHER LAPTOP TO CONNECT MORE CAMERAS THAT CAN RUN MY AI CAMERA PROGRAMS BUT ANYWAY THANKS FOR TRYING .  ITS A GOOD LITTLE PROGRAM WRITER FOR ANDROID DEVICES AND CAN USE THE CAMERA FOR AI .  IF U DONT NEED SERIAL USB CONNECTIVITY FOR YOUR APPS .  TRY IT OUT .  THERE IS NOT ALOT OF EXAMPLES COMPARED WITH PROCESSING . THERE MUST BE AT LEAST A COUPLE HUNDRED EXAMPLES WITH THE PROCESSING IDE THAT DOWN LOAD WITH PROCESSING. BUT I ONLY SEE MAYBE 5 TO 30 OR SO ON APDE SO THERE YOU GO .

You just make me to smile while coding. It's a beautiful apps and from me it's my best 2017 apps that i have installed. Thanks a lot from my "Heart".
loadImage() doesn't work, can't access to keyboard
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
loadImage() should work, but you need to put the image in the data folder first. You can go to Sketch Properties > Add File.

To open the keyboard in your sketch, see this Wiki article: https://goo.gl/gKvgxn

google_play_reviews.content: How to import processing.svg and processing.pdf
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
The shape library has been integrated into the core and no longer needs to be imported. Take a look in Examples/Basics/Shape.

The PDF library is a core library that is not available in Android mode, see this FAQ for more information: https://goo.gl/h6BxZo

google_play_reviews.content: Love it although resizing images doesn’t seem to work on both the galaxy s7 and s5 as it causes the app to either crash or not load images at all
By far, the neatest app I have ever installed. If you like programming, experimenting and or and intellectual toy, you will love this.
Can't get it to save my sketches, I've been lookin' through the options but got nothing.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Sketches should save automatically when APDE is closed. If sketches are not saving at all, then you have found a bug, and a very serious one at that. Please send us an email if this is the case so that we can find a solution.

google_play_reviews.content: How can u download video library
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Please see this FAQ entry: goo.gl/BdrMkG

The video library is not supported by Android mode, but video_android is an alternative linked from the wiki page above.

google_play_reviews.content: I loved this app since it first came out! Only feature I would like to see is a simple movie maker to record frames on the phone to upload easily and promote the product as well. Thanks for creating this!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We will definitely consider a movie maker. It is already possible to use saveFrame() (https://goo.gl/LVjPC5) to save the frames, but we will look into implementing a simple frame-compiler like the desktop PDE's Movie Maker tool.

google_play_reviews.content: I made the changes. Now program works.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
You must enable installation from unknown sources in Android settings in order to install APDE sketches because they run as standalone applications. The Windows version of Processing does not require this because Windows is much less locked down than Android.

You did not pay. APDE is free.

Please send us an email if you have further questions.

google_play_reviews.content: Great job man but This app Don't work with Ketai  library  ! Help me if exists an solition. Regards
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Please try the steps listed in the library installation wiki page and then the manual method described there if the automatic installer doesn't work: https://goo.gl/U2yEy7

If neither method works then please send us an email with more information. Ketai has worked for other users and should work for you as well.

google_play_reviews.content: Not rating five stars because it isn't possible to export an app. The editor won't let me create a keystore, so I can't export and share with friends. Edit: Also no hints as to where the unsigned apk is.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Please go to Settings/Build. Disable "Build on Internal Storage" and enable "Keep Build Folder". Now run the sketch. The APK signed with a debug certificate will be in "/sdcard/build/bin" as "sketchName.apk".

Please send us an email if you have further questions.

google_play_reviews.content: This app can make APKs with the power of the processing IDE and library. This is the best way to code on your phone. The APK installation and updating is smooth and the UI in the app is good. The ability to so easily create an APK with a custom image and name that goes on your home screen is awesome
This is a great app for making graphics, and also allows you to make games (to an extent). One thing I wish it did have, or was more clear, was allowing you to make the sketch into a live background.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Support for live wallpapers, watchfaces, and Cardboard was added in Android mode 4.0 for the desktop, which is currently toward the end of beta. APDE should be upgrading to Android mode 4.0 for the next major release, so you won't have to wait too long.

google_play_reviews.content: Dont get me wrong, I love processing but this very handy mobile version tends to delete my sketches and overwrite them with empty files, until that is fixed I am afraid i can not give more stars
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
We are aware of this bug: https://goo.gl/GikbYM

We are working to find a solution. In the meantime you can try the potential fix APK on the issue report link above or you can downgrade to v0.3.3 from the releases page: https://goo.gl/syTVxM

google_play_reviews.content: Processing is already an amazing prototyping tool, but having a pocket-sized version of it is even more useful.  I can write down any code idea that I have while travelling, and most of the desktop features are here, and if they're not, you can usually replicate them with minor tweaking.  In addition to that, through the use of libraries such as Ketai, accessing Android features has never been more straightforward. Overall a great port of the desktop version, the performance is here, and it's probably the most useful tool for anyone who wants to make Android apps FROM their Android device.   Looking forward to future updates. Keep up the good work, thank you Calsign Labs !
I needed this.
It's very usefull and great but when the sketch is in delay it get's grey and then nirmal again
Constantly erases sketches I've saved lost hours of work due to this program.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
We are sorry for the inconvenience and code lost...

This is a known issue. Please see issue #24 on GitHub for more information:

https://github.com/Calsign/APDE/issues/24

google_play_reviews.content: Very useful and fun for creative people.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: What is the complete stack trace for the NullPointerException? Please send us an email with more information so that we can fix the problem.

google_play_reviews.content: Best app for programs
many functions do not work like you have an error when you create custom shapes in createShape() function
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We have not encountered these issues. All of the examples under Topics / Create Shapes appear to be working as expected. Do these examples produce errors on your device? Please send us an email with more information so that we can sort out the problem.

google_play_reviews.content: Happy to see this app over here, but there is a big problem! I downloaded the ketai library and it did not install properly for some reason. I can't see the lib in the lib manager but when i try to install it again it says it's already installed. I can see the ketai lib examples but if i try to compile the code it gives an error saying library is not installed. Tried reinstalling processing, still says lib is already installed even though it's  not working.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Sometimes the library installer doesn't work properly. Open a file manager and navigate to external storage/Sketchbook/libraries/ and delete the Ketai folder. You may need to install the library manually, see this Wiki article for more information: https://goo.gl/Uy6EHO

google_play_reviews.content: Used to run great, loved making random sketches for friends and family but now it won't let me press the install button when running a sketch for the first time. Really weird thing is it used to let me install the sketch but I had to wait a couple of seconds before hitting the install button. I've seen many reviews get responses from you guys so I'm hoping I can help you guys figure out this bug. I know it's Christmas so I hope the developers have a great Christmas!  Edit: Excellent! Got a reply explaining exactly what the problem was and how to fix it. Top notch stuff, great job guys!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We apologize for not responding earlier. If anyone is having this issue, then please see: https://github.com/Calsign/APDE/wiki/Screen-Overlays-and-the-Install-Screen

google_play_reviews.content: Simply amazing! As powerful as the desktop IDE. Amazing job :)

The new update indeed looks great but it makes the Android apps more bulky.  I created an app which had about  4 MB of size using the previous version of APDE. Now, the same app consumes 10 MB of space using the newer version of APDE.  Also, even after the app (the one made using newer version) crashes, it doesn't show any dialog box regarding the app crash rather a blank screen.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
v0.4.0 upgraded to a newer version of Android mode that requires the Android support library, which makes the sketches larger. This is unfortunate but expected behavior.

The crashing issue sounds like a bug. Please send us an email with more information so that we can fix the problem.

google_play_reviews.content: This app works great. Program Apps in a nice C++ style IDE and test/run them right on your phone.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: This issue has been fixed in v0.4.0. Please consider updating your review.

google_play_reviews.content: Not in the progran nor network ?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can find general instructions for using APDE on GitHub: https://github.com/Calsign/APDE Tutorials for the Processing language are available on the Processing website: https://processing.org You can also view the Processing reference in-app by going to Tools/Open Reference.

google_play_reviews.content: I love processing, really quick to make sketches! I rate 11/10 stars!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: We have not encountered this issue. Can you please send us an email with more information? By chance do you have the storage permission enabled for APDE in Android settings?

google_play_reviews.content: Watch out if you're using version 0.4.0, for me it deleted a sketch's code after trying to run the sketch.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: For others experiencing this bug, we are working to fix the problem. See this GitHub issue for updates: https://github.com/Calsign/APDE/issues/24

This application is tremendous! It allows me to make progress debugging in small bursts throughout the day, rather than having to wait until I'm back in my office. For anyone with the issue where you cannot press the Install button; make sure that you temporarily disable any screen dimmers you have active. Adding an exclusion in Twilight for APDE fixed the problem for me.
Best I Love It
Great for coding in Processing from an android device.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: If you are using Android 7 (as indicated by Google Play) rather than 5, then this issue has been fixed in v0.4.0. Please consider updating your review.

Pretty good editor so far but I can't save my sketches to my sdCard(Or maybe I can idk) and I can't open sketches that are not in sketchbook (Ones I made on a pc)  Hope you can fix this!
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
To store the Sketchbook on the SD card, go to Settings / General / Sketchbook Location and select the SD card.

You can open any PDE file in APDE from an external file manager.

If these features aren't working properly, please send us an email so that we can fix the problem.

google_play_reviews.content: Still exploring what this can and can't do compared with the PC version but so far I cannot fault it!
Very useful Thank you.  Still learning processing so this helps loads. Nice to not have to start the pc up to practice coding. Then can easily Share apks ! Look forward to any future updates.
Tested on nexus 5 with cm13. Working wonderfully.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: This is a planned feature, but it might be a little bit before we get around to implementing it. We apologize for the inconvenience.

installs code as standalone app; meaning: sharable results, slightly longer compile process (which is perfect for me. glad/impressed it exists) uninstalling sketches seems to be a manual activity for later (read: whenever it's time for a new phone XD... >_>)

Brillant ap for testing processing and running on android. Only one problem.....when pasting code from another source it gets entered as one line, so i have to go through it all with the enter button. Still good though.
